title: Do schools in China teach English? - Quora
tags: Teaching English as a Foreign Language (TEFL)

response.answer_text: Yes, from primary/elementary school and right through Highschool and university. You may wonder why so few Chinese speak English. There are a few reasons. Generally, the language is not seen as being particularly useful for a lot of people. While some parents do encourage their children to do well in English, unless they have some use for it language skills can degrade quickly once they leave school. I learned German in Highschool, but I can barely introduce myself these days. Secondly, the exams are mostly written with little or no emphasis on speaking and listening, so people can generally read and write in English better than they can speak it.

Yes, all chinese students should learn English in China, and they should pass the English test every semester. All chinese students do a good job in written english instead of spoken English. So many people say chinese students learn English called dumb English.
Yes, there will be English course from primary school to university.Eve before kindergarten, most of mum will teach their babies. Chinese put highly attention on learning English.
Of course, we have to learn it from primary school to university, some parents may teach their kids a little younger, becoz better English maybe better in choosing a better school.
